text: Golf course at Pollibetta Old fashioned Spencer woodstove in a British building in Pollibetta Pollibetta is a small village in Kodagu district of Karnataka state, India. ==Location== Pollibetta is located between Gonikoppal and Siddapura towns. The distance to Gonikoppa is nine kilometers and the distance to Siddapura is eleven kilometers. https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Siddapura,+Karnataka,+India/Pollibetta,+Karnataka+571215,+India/@12.2685023,75.8969624,14z/data=!4m8!4m7!1m2!1m1!1s0x3ba5af0a99b68bc3:0xd6e2673adfa3a53e!1m2!1m1!1s0x3ba5bab90f9ee335:0x41700b815386bd5c!3e0 ==Post office== There is a post office in Polibetta village. The pincode is 571215. https://pincode.net.in/KARNATAKA/KODAGU/P/POLLIBETTA ==History== A British company called Pollibetta Coffee Estates Company Limited, London managed by Matheson and Company started a tea company ikn Pollibetta in 1943. In 1960, the company sold the shares to Indian public. In 1966, the company was renamed Consolidated Coffee Limited. Tata Tea Limited acquired the company in 1992. In 2000, the company was renamed Tata Coffee Limited. Tata Coffee - Corporate Heritage ==References== Category:Villages in Kodagu district
